'''Walrein''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''トドゼルガ''' ''Todoseruga'') is a dual-type {{2t|Ice|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Sealeo}} starting at [[level]] 44. It is the final form of {{p|Spheal}}.

==Biology==
Walrein is a large, sea lion-like Pokémon with a layer of blubber under its skin. It is primarily blue, with thin, white rings around its neck and lines on its fan-like tailfin. There are two long, ivory tusks in its upper jaw. It has a round snout and yellow eyes, and large tufts of white fur about its face and neck. Its four short legs have long flippers instead of feet.

Walrein lives in and around icy {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Sea Pokémon|seas}}, where it is insulated against the cold by its thick layer of blubber. This layer of fat also protects it from enemy attacks by causing them to bounce off. It can coat its body in ice and charge opponents to use its former [[signature move]], {{m|Ice Ball}}. While its long tusks are capable of crushing ice, they may break during battle. This Pokémon can be found in herds, which are fiercely protected by the leader.

==In the anime==
[[File:Rocky Walrein.png|230px|thumb|left|Walrein in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Walrein debuted in ''[[AG054|Fight for the Meteorite!]]'', under the ownership of {{tc|Team Aqua Grunt}}s. They reappeared in ''[[AG098|The Scuffle of Legends]]''.

A Walrein appeared in'' [[AG096|Training Wrecks]]'', under the ownership of [[Rocky]], who had a battle with {{Ash}}. Walrein battled {{AP|Pikachu}} and {{AP|Grovyle}}, alongside a {{DL|Rocky|Quagsire}}. Before Grovyle could attack Quagsire with its {{m|Leaf Blade}}, Walrein attacked Grovyle with its {{m|Ice Ball}}. Pikachu defeated Walrein in the end, while Grovyle took care of Quagsire.

A Walrein was {{ho|Katie}}'s final Pokémon during her battle with Ash in ''[[AG129|A Judgment Brawl]]''. The Ice Break Pokémon defeated {{AP|Swellow}} and {{AP|Corphish}} (the latter of whom was already tired out from battling Katie's {{p|Golduck}}), and was defeated by Ash's Grovyle.

===Minor appearances===
A Walrein appeared in ''[[AG144|A Hurdle for Squirtle]]'', under the ownership of a [[Pokémon Coordinator]] competing in the {{ci|Saffron}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

A large group of {{p|Spheal}}, {{p|Sealeo}}, and Walrein appeared in ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]''.

Multiple Walrein made brief cameo appearances in ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Archie Walrein Adventures.png|thumb|Walrein in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Walrein first appears in ''[[PS230|Walrein and Camerupt]]''. He was used by [[Archie]] to battle against [[Maxie]], and later when ironically fighting alongside the Magma Leader against {{adv|Ruby}} and {{adv|Sapphire}}, though they are able to exploit the two leader's weakness of taking little notice of each other's presence and easily won. A few more volumes later, in the climax of the {{chap|Ruby & Sapphire}}, Archie sends out several more Walrein alongside Maxie's multiple {{p|Houndoom}} to buy time for the two to escape, but are thwarted.

In ''[[PS335|The Final Battle VII]]'', under the guise of [[Guile Hideout]], the same Team Aqua leader sends out a Walrein that is easily beaten by [[Poli]] alongside his {{p|Masquerain}} (beaten by [[Polibo]]).
{{-}}

==Trivia==
===Origin===
Walrein is based on a {{wp|walrus}}.

====Name origin====
Walrein may be a combination of ''{{wp|walrus}}'' and a corruption of ''rain'' or ''reign''.

Todoseruga may be a combination of 胡獱 ''todo'' ({{wp|sea lion}}) and 海象 ''seiuchi'' (walrus).
